result.execSummary:
The defendant James T Shuda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Make court ordered child support payments.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Comply with Sex Offender Registry.   Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.
No contact direct or indirect with any minors except for his son as allowed by DOC. No contact with D.B.

supervisions.notes: CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION APPLY TO ALL COUNTS.

Sentencing Hearing, 12/3/18

08:19 AM Defendant James T Shuda in court with attorney Aileen Henry.  Defendant James T Shuda in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Defendant ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit fo a PSI.  State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Defendant apologizes to the court, makes statement.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
from CP with information for court to consider at sentencing.

records.addlTxt: for DNA Sample

Defendant James T Shuda in court with attorney Aileen Henry.  Defendant James T Shuda in custody.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1, 2 & 3.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1, 2 & 3.  Court dismisses Cts. 4 - 8 but reads in for sentencing.    Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties.  Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.  State/Defense indicate they have a joint recommendation but ask that sentencing be set off for 30-45 days. Atty Henry indicates defendant is waiving his right to a PSI. Court questions defendant on waiver, finds waiver made freely & voluntarily.  Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2018 at 08:15 am.

Defendant James T Shuda in court with attorney Aileen Henry.  Defendant James T Shuda in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews competency evaluation done by Dr. Steven Benson. Court inquires of defendant if he is competent or not competent to proceed. Defendant feels he is competent to proceed. State asks court to rely on Dr. Benson's report. Atty Henry relying on Dr. Benson's report. Court finds defendant competent to proceed. Set for prelim. (joint prelim. for all 4 files). Court addresses Atty Henry motion to amend bond. State not prepared to argue bond today, Atty Henry to set bond motion hearing and prelim. with JA Ripp. Bond remains in effect.

No contact direct or indirect with any child under age 18 except can have contact with his son if supervised by responsible adult who is not a witness in any of the files. Not to possess any pornography including child pornography. No internet access or use including social medial sites.

Court addresses Atty Henry request for modification of defendants bond. Atty Henry makes statement.  State objects to bond modification, makes statement. Court makes statement, not changing $3,000 cash bond, does revise bond to allow contact with son if supervised by responsible adult who is not a witness in any of the files. All other conditions remain in effect.

Defendant James T Shuda in court with attorney Aileen Henry.  Defendant James T Shuda in custody.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Henry indicates defendant had previously indicated he was willing to waive his right to a preliminary hearing so State did not subpoena witnesses. In talking to defendant today, he now wishes to have preliminary hearing in all cases. Court will reschedule preliminary hearing in all files.

Attorney Shane Laughton Brabazon in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions Atty Brabazon on defendants whereabouts. Atty Brabazon has no information as to the defendants whereabouts. State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant. Atty Brabazon makes motion to withdraw from the case. State objects, this case has been pending for a year and it hasn't gone anywhere. Court takes matter under advisement, will wait to see if defendant is picked up and what his position is on Atty Brabazon's motion to withdraw.  State requests costs for Officer Mielke as he's here on his day off. Court takes costs under advisement. State to submit costs to the court to be decided at a later date.
